tsjson 0.0.0.9000

Show the annotated syntax tree of a JSON file or string

Source: R/tree-sitter.R
syntax_tree_json.Rd

Show the annotated syntax tree of a JSON file or string

Usage

syntax_tree_json(file = NULL, text = NULL, ranges = NULL, options = NULL)

Arguments

file

Path of a JSON file. Use either file or text.

text

JSON string. Use either file or text.

ranges

Can be used to parse part(s) of the input. It must be a data frame with integer columns start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col, start_byte, end_byte, in this order.

options

List of options, see tsjson_options(). This argument must be named and cannot be abbreviated.

Examples

syntax_tree_json(text = "{ \"a\": true, \"b\": [1, 2, 3] }")
#> document                  1|
#> └─object                   |
#>   ├─{                      |{
#>   ├─pair                   |
#>   │ ├─string               |
#>   │ │ ├─"                  |  "
#>   │ │ ├─string_content     |   a
#>   │ │ └─"                  |    "
#>   │ ├─:                    |     :
#>   │ └─true                 |       true
#>   ├─,                      |           ,
#>   ├─pair                   |
#>   │ ├─string               |
#>   │ │ ├─"                  |             "
#>   │ │ ├─string_content     |              b
#>   │ │ └─"                  |               "
#>   │ ├─:                    |                :
#>   │ └─array                |
#>   │   ├─[                  |                  [
#>   │   ├─number             |                   1
#>   │   ├─,                  |                    ,
#>   │   ├─number             |                      2
#>   │   ├─,                  |                       ,
#>   │   ├─number             |                         3
#>   │   └─]                  |                          ]
#>   └─}                      |                            }
